title: Learning Subjective Language
descriptions: This paper explores the concept of subjectivity in natural language, focusing on learning subjective language from corpora. The authors identify various types of subjective language clues, including unique words, collocations, and adjectives/verbs identified using distributional similarity. They evaluate these clues on different datasets, demonstrating their effectiveness in recognizing subjective language. The paper also introduces a density feature to disambiguate potentially subjective expressions in context. The results show that the proposed approach can achieve high precision in identifying subjective language, making it useful for various NLP applications.

    <S sid="538" ssid="29">We hypothesize that most objective sentences identified by our system are dominated in the discourse by subjective sentences and that we are moving toward identifying subjective discourse segments.</S>
